revised_title: Subharmonic Resonance and Trapped Waves in Venice Lagoon Storm Gates
tldr: The authors study the resonance mechanism of storm gates designed for the Venice Lagoon. They identify the existence of trapped modes as a consequence of the gates' articulated construction and show that subharmonic resonance can occur due to normally incident waves. The authors provide a new inviscid theory of trapped modes and present experimental evidence confirming the natural frequency predicted by the theory.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
